reviews.review_msg: Dr. Peplak is an amazing professor, and the lecture material was really interesting. We had the option to participate in two online discussions for 2% extra credit. The assignments were easy, and I found the final exam even easier than the midterm. For the exams, I recommend going through the lecture recordings and slides.

She gives really interesting lectures but they are very full. She seems to really care about her students. The lectures are recorded and lecture slides are posted but participation is checked with iClicker. The exams are quite difficult - study both the lectures and textbook well. The assignments are unique and help you apply knowledge well!

Honestly as a prof she's great. She talks well, she's nice, and she's helpful if you have a question or anything. She cares about the topic and does her best to make it interesting. She did iClicker attendance which i didn't like though. Exams had a ton of material. Like you had to basically memorize a bunch of the textbook and lectures.

Amazing professor. Really knows her stuff, and tests are practical (ie not memorization, know the content). Very involved in lectures, definitely one of the least boring psyc classes I've taken. One is that the exams are pretty difficult, you need to study properly and know subtle differences between MC answers.

Dr. Peplak's lectures are fun in theory but in reality she makes them extremely boring. She reads off the slides, if she could make them more engaging somehow, I'd like her class. Exams are difficult, with some MC questions not covered in class. TAs also have different expectations than her for assignments, making assignments hard to complete.

Professor Peplak seems like a very nice person but unfortunately her classes are a nightmare. She crams as much information as she can into lectures, and claims that it should be that way because 250 is a breadth course, although no other class I have taken at SFU has been so unnecessarily content heavy.

yeah the lectures are dry but easy enough to follow along, i don't think too much information is crammed into a lecture like others have said

HOWEVER, her tests really are in fact difficult. i thought maybe the others complaining about this just didn't study enough but i studied extensively and was still stumped by a large number of questions

She seems like a lovely and caring person who is passionate about what she teaches. However, her tests were absurdly difficult and barely seemed to reflect what we actually were learning in class. The assignments were fine though they seemed pointless to any actual learning. Overall, her class didn't seem fairly assessed.

Fun class Professor Peplak played lots of videos in class to keep us engaged. Lots of easy participation marks but you have to go to lecture. Interesting topics and assignments were quite simple. I recommend taking a course with Joanna.

I took Psyc 250 with Dr.Peplak and I really enjoyed her course!! I thought her midterms and final were very fair and her long answer questions were really simple if you payed attention in class and took notes. Her assignments consisted of a one page paper and an infographic which were pretty fun to do and took little time.

Weird experience. I really enjoyed the lectures and she's really kind and  passionate about the course material. Assignments weren't too bad. But the exams were a total shot out of left field. One of the hardest multiple choice exams I've ever taken. The questions being tested were really obscure and idk how she thought we would know some of those.

She is very kind and welcoming, her class had a very positive atmosphere. However, the exams were far more difficult than expected. So much material to study and very specific questions were asked on the exam. Only take this course if you are willing to study A LOT.

Joanna herself is very sweet, but her teaching style needs a bit of improvement. The tests had little to do with what was taught in class and almost seemed like outside research was required to answer some weird questions. The grading criteria for the assignments was not rly clear, but attendance/participation was worth 20%, so show up to lecture.

Peplak is sweet enough but her assignments lacked clarity, lectures were messy and overloaded with minute info, & tests were not well-aligned with lecture material so ensure to study extremely hard. The textbook for this class is over 2000 pages. Required to purchase $110+ online package for mandatory participation so something to keep in mind.
Assignments where a little vague but 20% of mark is participation and homework n completion which takes almost no time. Tests were tough but not too difficult. Overall enjoyable class

Joanna's lectures are boring and unfortunately participation matters via iclicker + location. Her assignment criteria is very vague however it is possible to get 100% on them. Her exams are messed up and are very tricky. She offers zero guidance on what to study when there's an abundance of information to pull from. Awful tests, would not recommend

This course's assessment is unfairly skewed towards multiple-choice exams, filled with obscure questions straight from the depths of the textbook. Despite exhaustive preparation, grades were dismal, with assignments failing to correlate with exam content. The excessive workload and studying paired with low grades deterred me from more psyc courses.

Never have I been so conflicted. You can tell she's passionate and kind but lectures lacked a lot of engagement opportunities for students to learn and connect with one another. Unrealistic expectations for full time students. 70+ slides per week, vague homework assignments, little flexibility when offered suggestions on how to accommodate students
